description: Borrowed from Late Latin vegetālis, from vegetō.

adjectives.description: vegetal (comparative more vegetal, superlative most vegetal)

entries.meaning: (now rare, historical) Capable of growth and reproduction, but not feeling or reason (often opposed to sensible and rational). [from 15th c.]
Pertaining to vegetables or plants. [from 16th c.]
examples: The Computer Center is muffled and dim, warm with whiffs of sourness, of body odor, and of the vegetal smells of dirt embedded in clothes that were advancing in the direction of compost.
This melancholy extends itself not to men only, but even to vegetals and sensibles.
